prompt: <description>Part 1 The first part to construct is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved, pointed end. The prism has a flat base and a flat top, and the curved end is angled. 1. Create a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation. Sketch 1. Create a new face at the XY plane. 2. Draw a line from (0, 0.0345) to (0.1026, 0). 3. Draw an arc from (0.1026, 0) to (0.6474, 0) with a midpoint at (0.375, 0.1958). 4. Draw a line from (0.6474, 0) to (0.75, 0.0345). 5. Draw an arc from (0.75, 0.0345) to (0, 0.0345) with a midpoint at (0.375, 0.3041). 6. Draw a circle centered at (0.0793, 0.0792) with a radius of 0.0225. 7. Draw a circle centered at (0.6707, 0.0792) with a radius of 0.0225. Extrusion 1. Extrude the sketch by 0.0541 units towards the positive Z direction. 2. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 3. Perform a 'New Body Feature Operation' for this part. Part 2 The second part is a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole through its center. The object is symmetrical and has a smooth surface. 1. Create a new coordinate system at (0.1498, 0.1772, 0) with no rotation. Sketch 1. Create a new face parallel to the XY plane at Z = 0. 2. Draw a circle centered at (0.1082, 0.1082) with a radius of 0.1082. 3. Draw a circle centered at (0.1082, 0.1082) with a radius of 0.0744. 4. Create another face parallel to the XY plane at Z = sketch\\_scale * 0.1082, where sketch\\_scale is 0.4503. 5. Repeat steps 2 and 3 on this new face. Extrusion 1. Extrude both sketches by 0.0541 units towards the positive Z direction. 2. Scale the sketches by a factor of 0.4503. 3. Perform a 'Join Feature Operation' for this part. Part 3 The third part consists of two cylinders with a flat top and bottom, positioned side by side. 1. Create a new coordinate system at (0.1837, 0.211, 0) with no rotation. Sketch 1. Create a new face parallel to the XY plane at Z = 0. 2. Draw a circle centered at (0.0744, 0.0744) with a radius of 0.0744. 3. Create another face parallel to the XY plane at Z = 0.246, where 0.246 is the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal. 4. Draw a circle centered at (0.3083, 0.0744) with a radius of 0.0744. Extrusion 1. Extrude the first sketch by 0.246 units towards the positive Z direction. 2. Extrude the second sketch by 0.246 units towards the positive Z direction. 3. Perform a 'Cut Feature Operation' for this part. Final Shape The final shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 3 units long, 2 units wide, and 1 unit tall. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of about 0.5 units.</description>
